data.title: Are Money Orders Safe to Mail in Massachusetts?
data.meta_description: Sending cash and checks in the mail is a big mistake but what about money orders?
data.text:
Nowadays technology is so advanced that it's easier than ever for scammers to take your identity, rob you of your money, and put you in a world of hurt which is a big reason why you shouldn't send checks in the mail.

Massachusetts Residents Can Still Legally Send Checks in the Mail But the USPS Advises Against It

The reason why the USPS doesn't recommend sending checks in the mail is because fraud cases are up and checks aren't making it to the correct recipients. You can read more about this by going here.

What Form of Payment is Okay for Massachusetts Residents to Send By Mail?

If you are sending payment by mail stay away from checks and you certainly don't want to send cash. Instead, the USPS recommends sending money orders. The USPS' official website notes the following regarding money order payments by mail.

When sending money by mail, use money orders as a safe alternative to cash and personal checks. U.S. Postal ServiceÂ® money orders are affordable, widely accepted, and never expire. Your money order receipt will help you track your payment and show proof of value in case the money order gets lost, stolen, or damaged.
